excerpts: We order Shrimp, Skirt Steak and Pulled Chicken Tacos.
All tacos are 2 per order.
pulled chicken tacos.author: Sandy B.
pulled chicken tacos.review:
Tacos shouldn't only be consume on Tuesdays, right? Good any day of the week in my opinion. Chisme is located in the Union Square area right across from my favorite restaurant, Liholiho. Very cute interior with honey bears artwork along the walls. Open space with a good amount of seating. 

Concept: Order and take a number. Self serve water and utensils.

I came with a group of 4. We order Shrimp, Skirt Steak and Pulled Chicken Tacos. All tacos are 2 per order. My favorite was the shrimp tacos, so much flavors and texture in that bite. It was delicious! 

We also order ordered Papas Rojas, Guac and Chips, Pinchelotes and 
Cauliflower Civiche. The papas rojas (potatoes) was so good that my group order another one. I was not a fan of the cauliflower civiche. I was hoping they had their roasted cauliflower but bummer, no longer on their menu. 

We got the owner himself to serve us, which was amazing. He gave us great service, super friendly. My overall experience was good. The food was tasty and the presentation is Instagram worthy. Not my favorite taco spot in the city but will be making my way back very soon.

excerpts: 2x Pulled Chicken Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)
pulled chicken tacos.author: Kaje Y.
pulled chicken tacos.review:
As my yelp buddies and I were in search of our next date night, Chisme was recommended. I skipped the yelp newsletter that featured Chisme, but alas, our dinner location was set.

We entered into a fairly large area. We observed that it's an order-first-then-sit-down type of place. Along the wall are a few cute... bears? (They're also at he Union Square Ice Rink). 

While waiting for the group, I started with a Panda Petals Saison. It was pretty tasty! 

When the group got here, this was what we decided on:

2x Shrimp Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)
2x Skirt Steak Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)
2x Pulled Chicken Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)

2x Papas Rojas
1x Guac and Chips
2x Pinchelotes (Corn on the cob - 2 per order)
1x Cauliflower Civiche

Our general consensus was Steak, Shrimp, Chicken in that order. I personally LOVED the flavours in the shrimp taco. 

We initially only ordered 1 papas rojas, but decided it was yummy enough to get another order! The cauliflower civiche, while a bit odd in theory, worked pretty well, however it was missing a little something that I can't put my finger on.

The guac was spot on, and the pinchelotes were quite good. Personally, I'd love more it if it had a hint of garlic on it!

I spent some time talking to the owner on the thought process of establishing this place. He had an idea for each dish and how it should taste. There was one dish we wanted to try, but he took it off the menu due to it coming out a little inconsistent. That tells you a lot of what this place is trying to offer. There's also a lack of arrogance and he seems to be customer focused.

Overall, this place does well and is heading in the right direction. I was really happy with the dishes. I really look forward to an updated menu in a few months to see if any other unique dishes pop up to try. 

I'll be back, to try all the beers, and definitely for more steak and shrimp tacos!

excerpts: Our favorites are the chicken quesadillas and pulled chicken tacos!
Also, the guacamole is SOO good!!!
We really enjoy coming here when we come to the city!
pulled chicken tacos.author: Angel L.
pulled chicken tacos.review: Soooooo delicious!!!!!! The food here is amazing!!! Our favorites are the chicken quesadillas and pulled chicken tacos! Also, the guacamole is SOO good!!! We really enjoy coming here when we come to the city!

excerpts: I ordered the shrimp tacos (which only came with 2) and chips and guac which totaled over $20.
Again, its a good place and worth trying.
Just be prepared for the sticker price!
shrimp tacos.author: Rhett B.
shrimp tacos.review: Visiting Chismse Cantina for the first time on Sutter Street today. It's easily identifiable due to the teal doors, blue gate, and awning in front. It's a small business with reasonable rustic seating options and friendly staff. It's expensive for the Quantity of food you receive, but, the food is good. I'd recommend the shrimp or skirt steak tacos. I ordered the shrimp tacos (which only came with 2) and chips and guac which totaled over $20. Again, its a good place and worth trying. Just be prepared for the sticker price!

excerpts: I ended up with shrimp tacos and paid the difference.
The shrimp tacos were much better and I really enjoyed them!
shrimp tacos.author: Alysia T.
shrimp tacos.review:
Came here with some friends who were visiting SF to grab a quick lunch - and I am so impressed with the service and how sweet the staff was! 

I never had a jackfruit taco in my life and was feeling very adventurous. I decided to try it after someone recommended it to me and realized after one bite that I hate jackfruit (if you are a fan, more power to you). But I did not like the texture or the sweet flavor because I am a spicy flavor kind of gal. 

After my disappointment with the taco I was hesitant/embarrassed about telling the staff, but they were so accommodating that they let me return that taco plate and order a different one! I ended up with shrimp tacos and paid the difference. The shrimp tacos were much better and I really enjoyed them!

excerpts: Shrimp tacos - delicious, plenty of shrimp.
I was worried they would skimp out.
shrimp tacos.author: Dianna C.
shrimp tacos.review:
Shrimp tacos - delicious, plenty of shrimp. I was worried they would skimp out. They did not! 

Jackfruit vegan taco - I've been super curious about jackfruit as a meat substitute. It definitely looks like meat, but it doesn't taste like meat. However this taco was pretty dang delicious. 

Coconut horchata - I never get horchata, but the coconut was screaming for us to try it. MC doesn't like horchata either, but we both were highly obsessed. Not sweet at all, which is how we both like it!!! 

Churro - I wish there was an option for no caramel sauce, since I know not everyone likes caramel, BUT it was really good. It was still warm when we had it sitting out while we finished eating the rest of our tacos. Comes with fresh vanilla whipped cream. 

Water - it's colored.... why?? The only unnecessary thing there. Haha. 

I want to go back to try the other tacos.

excerpts: I had the shrimp tacos and my date had the steak tacos.
shrimp tacos.author: Denise L.
shrimp tacos.review:
Here's my chisme on Chisme: I think that the tacos are really flavorful and were prepared with an interesting twist. I had the shrimp tacos and my date had the steak tacos. Honestly, it reminded me of a blue apron recipe I cooked with a few months ago. 

The coconut horchata was my favorite item here. I'd prob come back just for this. I love horchata in general. 

The churros were very unique as well since they were filled with caramel in the center. 

Not sure if I'd make this my go-to place in my new hood but I appreciate the concept of what seems like "healthier" Mexicali food.

excerpts: The shrimp tacos were bursting with flavor with fresh mango salsa.
And the guac?
Oh the guac!
Oh guac!
How I adore thee.
The guac here is so fresh and chunky.
The chips are obviously home made since the were warm and thick.
shrimp tacos.author: Gina M.
shrimp tacos.review:
Ay chisme! Que rico! We made it in here 15 minutes before they shut their doors, unbeknownst to us. But we would have never known that because the young lady welcomed us into the restaurant very warmly and gave us suggestions on what to order. 
We had a seat and within 5 minutes, our food was delivered. As we continued to eat we over heard her welcoming people in but kindly informing them they were closed for the night. She kindly came over to assure us they would begin cleaning but to please take our time eating as there was no rush for us to leave the establishment. 

Food: WOW Chisme! My wife and I are STILL talking about these tacos despite us being alllllll the way in Maryland. The chicken tacos were so delicious with the right amount of spice. 
The shrimp tacos were bursting with flavor with fresh mango salsa. 
And the guac? Oh the guac! Oh guac! How I adore thee. The guac here is so fresh and chunky. The chips are obviously home made since the were warm and thick. Yum!

Long story short we ate here twice. Luckily the taco joint was about 5 blocks from our hotel. If I could have, I would have made it here 3 times if I could. 

One thing is for sure - Chisme will see me again if I ever find myself in San Fran again. 

Yum!

excerpts: Greeted by a huge smile, we gathered some information about the menu before deciding on the skirt steak tacos ($11), the shrimp tacos ($10), and the cauliflower ceviche ($7).
The food was out in a prompt fashion, and our taste buds lit up when we took our first bite.
Holy moly peanut butter MOLE.
These flavors WORK.
Every bite was just like the first - magical.
Adding the lime wedge to the cauliflower ceviche gave it an acidity that perfect the dish, and the staff brought more chips as soon as we finished the first batch.
shrimp tacos.author: Hannah S.
shrimp tacos.review:
Taco Tuesday anyone?? This place is as good as it gets! Walking in, I felt instantly calmed by the beautiful details of the place; the Fnnch mural, the simplistic light fixtures, the 'magic' pink water... Everything in there made me want to stay.

Greeted by a huge smile, we gathered some information about the menu before deciding on the skirt steak tacos ($11), the shrimp tacos ($10), and the cauliflower ceviche ($7). The food was out in a prompt fashion, and our taste buds lit up when we took our first bite. Holy moly peanut butter MOLE. These flavors WORK. Every bite was just like the first - magical. Adding the lime wedge to the cauliflower ceviche gave it an acidity that perfect the dish, and the staff brought more chips as soon as we finished the first batch.

We were so blown away that we decided to go in for dessert as well. We had a hard time deciding between the Sweet Chimichanga ($7) and the Caramel Churros ($7). However, we had no regrets when our caramel stuffed churros arrived with the sweetest, homemade whipped cream. Every.Damn.Bite was incredible. I have never enjoyed a churro so wholeheartedly.

So yes, come here. This is a humble restaurant serving some of the best damn food around at a totally affordable place. I am #blessed to live just around the corner and will be a frequent visitor here!

shrimp tacos.review:
Not too shabby. I tried two shrimp tacos with a delicious sauce for $10 b4 tax. New spot with cool furniture and vibe. I would definitely try this spot again. I wanted to get the chicken tacos but I'm glad I trusted the waiters suggestion.

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews. excerpts: The shrimp tacos are very savory; however, I had a small taste of the jackfruit taco and was blown away, much better than carnitas tacos.
I guess, I'll have to come back!
shrimp tacos.author: Joselin C.
shrimp tacos.review: Delicious! Wished I could mix the taco orders. The shrimp tacos are very savory; however, I had a small taste of the jackfruit taco and was blown away, much better than carnitas tacos. I guess, I'll have to come back!

excerpts: just because I love Mexican food) I will say that the mole sauce is pretty much as amazing as the one my grandma made, Shrimp Tacos with the Mango salsa, mole and queso fresco is definitely my favorite,
The Via Via (vegan) or Plantain Tacos is my second favorite choice, with the coconut ranch sooo good!
shrimp tacos.author: Michelle C.
shrimp tacos.review: This place is probably my favorite Mexican restaurant in USA, very authentic. I'm half Mexican and when we are talking about MEXICAN TASTING, I am very picky (just because I love Mexican food) I will say that the mole sauce is pretty much as amazing as the one my grandma made, Shrimp Tacos with the Mango salsa, mole and queso fresco is definitely my favorite, The Via Via (vegan) or Plantain Tacos is my second favorite choice, with the coconut ranch sooo good! They also have an amazing vegan cauliflower ceviche, a super tasty poblano mashed potato, the poblano pepper (not spicy) totally make it very unique. And of course the  "Pinchelotes" makes me feel like if I'm in Mexico City, They also have Churrossss con salsa de Chocolate caliente so yummy, plus they always have great spanish music , the service is very friendly and kind. Go try Chisme!!!

excerpts: The shrimp tacos were beautiful and flavorful, and two tacos was a perfect portion for me (granted I don't have a big appetite).
My SO got the corn and LOVED it, and my friends who got the churros were very happy with their choice.
While it's a little on the pricey side, it's definitely on par with other gourmet taco places (and their tacos are more inventive than most others I've seen).
Will be back for sure!
shrimp tacos.author: Megan B.
shrimp tacos.review: Great tacos in a casual setting! Nothing bad to say about this place. The shrimp tacos were beautiful and flavorful, and two tacos was a perfect portion for me (granted I don't have a big appetite). My SO got the corn and LOVED it, and my friends who got the churros were very happy with their choice. While it's a little on the pricey side, it's definitely on par with other gourmet taco places (and their tacos are more inventive than most others I've seen). Will be back for sure!

excerpts: I love their shrimp tacos with the peanut mole, mango salsa, purple cabbage, queso, and cilantro.
Oh myy goOdness!
And their hot sauce with it is absolutely delicious.
I could eat 5.
Yumm.
I love how they use El Milagro chips, from Chicago.
They are the best chips hands down!
The owner is from Chicago, which is cool, because I am too.
Can't wait to show my parents when they visit!
I tell everyone about this place!
Their guac and chips are a great size, and the plantain taco is so good too!
shrimp tacos.author: Alexis C.
shrimp tacos.review: Soul good! I love their shrimp tacos with the peanut mole, mango salsa, purple cabbage, queso, and cilantro. Oh myy goOdness! And their hot sauce with it is absolutely delicious. I could eat 5. Yumm. I love how they use El Milagro chips, from Chicago. They are the best chips hands down! The owner is from Chicago, which is cool, because I am too. Can't wait to show my parents when they visit! I tell everyone about this place! Their guac and chips are a great size, and the plantain taco is so good too!

excerpts: Absolutely loved the Steak and Shrimp Tacos here....
shrimp tacos.author: Kyle B.
shrimp tacos.review:
Absolutely loved the Steak and Shrimp Tacos here....wow! 

I also loved the presentation of the Chips & Guac. Definitely recommend for a cute date night spot or even if you are on the run. Great part of a town and friendly staff.

Will definitely be eating here again to try all their Veggie Tacos!

excerpts: The guacamole portions are small for the price and the shrimp tacos were very salty and heavy on the chipotle seasoning.
shrimp tacos.author: Sona P.
shrimp tacos.review: This place has a lot of potential but menu needs refining.  They do not allow mixing and matching of tacos, and there are no tacos available ala carte.  The guacamole portions are small for the price and the shrimp tacos were very salty and heavy on the chipotle seasoning.

excerpts: Shrimp tacos:

(coworker rated) finger licking good - didn't leave a trace on her plate
Mashed potatoes: (coworker rated) "so full, but
I'm going to finish these anyways" totally worth overstuffing yourself for
Magic Aqua
: ok their free water doesn't just add a lemon or cucumber, they infuse berries and it's like drinking (
shrimp tacos.author: Michelle W.
shrimp tacos.review:
Living in San Diego for 6 years has really set a high taco bar for me. Everyone says "oh go to Mission - it's like street food straight from Tijuana" - not true. I have yet to find a taco place I can call SD worthy, until Chisme. Scene.

My co-workers and I wanted to grab a quick bite before our pottery off-site and we stumbled upon this place. Gluten free options, dairy free options? Yep - we all can eat here.

Steak tacos: medium rare, well marinated and oh so juicy and tender. 
Chips & Guac: you can definitely tell these chips are not store bought - they're thick with a non-preservative crunch, refills aplenty without judgement. Guac is as guac as guac can get - yummy.
Shrimp tacos: (coworker rated) finger licking good - didn't leave a trace on her plate
Mashed potatoes: (coworker rated) "so full, but I'm going to finish these anyways" totally worth overstuffing yourself for
Magic Aqua: ok their free water doesn't just add a lemon or cucumber, they infuse berries and it's like drinking (healthy-ish) purple drank

Last but not least - the service was amazing. Coworker accidentally forgot to mention no cheese on her tacos and said it under her breath as they brought hers out and without missing a step they made her new tacos and let us wolves fight for her cheesy tacos. 

I'll be back.

excerpts: I had the shrimp tacos and thought they were delicious.
We also ordered the Flower Basket with crispy coconut kale and fried pink pickled cauliflower.
shrimp tacos.author: Kelly T.
shrimp tacos.review:
We stumbled across Chisme on our quest to find a restaurant open in between lunch and dinner hours since we had just flown into town. The restaurant was mostly empty when we arrived so we received our food quickly even though it's cooked to order. 

I had the shrimp tacos and thought they were delicious. We also ordered the Flower Basket with crispy coconut kale and fried pink pickled cauliflower. We all agreed the kale was delicious but the cauliflower was just ok. 

We were lucky enough to be there the first day Chisme offered homemade sangria and we were happy to partake. :) It was tasty without being overly sweet but a couple diners in our party thought it was a little light on the wine. 

The staff was very friendly and attentive. I would give them 5 stars but I do think the price is just a little high for what you get. It was definitely delicious and worth trying!

excerpts: I always get the shrimp tacos it's perfectly seasoned and has a nice kick.
I'm usually not into horchata
but damn it's good here.
shrimp tacos.author: Sonya S.
shrimp tacos.review: Loved going into this vibrant and friendly place for lunch during work! Strange I know but the mashed potatoes are a MUST share. I always get the shrimp tacos it's perfectly seasoned and has a nice kick. I'm usually not into horchata but damn it's good here.

excerpts: Went last Friday and ordered the shrimp tacos, which were delicious.
My BF orders the steak and couldn't say enough good things about them also.
We would definite go back!
shrimp tacos.author: Ashley N.
shrimp tacos.review: This place is great! Went last Friday and ordered the shrimp tacos, which were delicious. My BF orders the steak and couldn't say enough good things about them also. We would definite go back!

The churros are delicious and decadent.
Fantastic beer selection from San Francisco's own Barebottle Brewery, and the people behind the counter are always friendly.

shrimp tacos.review: Chisme is an outstanding addition to the neighborhood. The mahi mahi tacos are some of the best fish tacos money can buy and the shrimp tacos are no joke either. The churros are delicious and decadent. Fantastic beer selection from San Francisco's own Barebottle Brewery, and the people behind the counter are always friendly.

excerpts: The shrimp tacos are a MUST have.
The service was amazing and the churros were perfect
shrimp tacos.author: Eric P.
shrimp tacos.review: Came here around dinner time with a group of friends. The tacos are all so flavorful and the chips are super fresh. The shrimp tacos are a MUST have. The service was amazing and the churros were perfect

excerpts: My favorite by far were the shrimp tacos.
They're served on corn tortillas (the owner says they're from El Milagro in Chicago!)
shrimp tacos.author: Tori M.
shrimp tacos.review:
This place is AMAZING! They just opened in lower nob hill a couple days ago and there's seriously nothing like this in SF! 

I was drawn in by the super cute Fnnch mural and decided to stop by on opening day to try out the tacos. They have 6 total on the menu and three of them are vegan friendly. Amazing. My favorite by far were the shrimp tacos. They're served on corn tortillas (the owner says they're from El Milagro in Chicago!) with huge sautéed shrimp, purple cabbage, the most delicious mango salsa, and a drizzle of their house peanut mole. 

The menu is super fresh and most items are vegan friendly which is a much needed addition to the San Fran taco scene. For the guac and chips they give you the option of adding in pomegranate or mango to it for a small extra charge. Do it. Totally worth it! 

From the delicious fairly-priced food, to the adorable interior, this place is definitely worth trying out!

excerpts: I always get the shrimp tacos, my husband gets the steak.
Whatever sauce they use is absolutely incredible.
Super tasty with a spicy kick.
Get the churros for dessert!
Customer service is superb.
We'll be back a million more times.
shrimp tacos.author: Kayla N.
shrimp tacos.review: Absolutely delicious! I always get the shrimp tacos, my husband gets the steak. Whatever sauce they use is absolutely incredible. Super tasty with a spicy kick. Get the churros for dessert! Customer service is superb. We'll be back a million more times.

excerpts: The shrimp tacos...mmmmmm...
I was a bit hesitant to try this place since it's new and might need to work out service kinks.
Beer was so reasonably priced and again, those shrimp tacos...
shrimp tacos.author: Sean W.
shrimp tacos.review: The shrimp tacos...mmmmmm...I was a bit hesitant to try this place since it's new and might need to work out service kinks. Beer was so reasonably priced and again, those shrimp tacos...

excerpts: Shrimp tacos.
Chips.
shrimp tacos.author: Alex F.
shrimp tacos.review:
High points: Ginger, lime, and mint tea.  Shrimp tacos.  Chips.  Hostess.  

Not-so-high points:  Too heavy handed on the mole sauce.  It is a good sauce, just too much of it.  This is the first mole that I actually liked, though.  So I got that going for me.

The guacamole is good, too, but I prefer mine with onion and tomato mixed in.  Chisme's guac is made fresh with avocado, cilantro, lime, and salt.  Simple, clean, and tasty, but I miss the onion and tomato.

excerpts: They have the best shrimp tacos and elote I've had in the city.
The shrimp tacos come two per order, and I really appreciate the fact that they're sautéed rather than fried!
I'll definitely be back!
shrimp tacos.author: Matt B.
shrimp tacos.review: I tried Chisme out this past weekend. They have the best shrimp tacos and elote I've had in the city. The shrimp tacos come two per order, and I really appreciate the fact that they're sautéed rather than fried! I'll definitely be back!

excerpts: I had the chicken, skirt steak and shrimp tacos and all were great.
Friendly staff too!
shrimp tacos.author: Mo D.
shrimp tacos.review: Delicious tacos and great atmosphere! Was in town for a few nights and well I love tacos! I'd consider myself a taco expert (only because I eat too many tacos), and I loved each one. I had the chicken, skirt steak and shrimp tacos and all were great. Friendly staff too!

excerpts: I tried their eggplant tacos, shrimp tacos and the flower basket.
All three were fantastically delicious.
Sweet people to sweeten the deal.
shrimp tacos.author: Jake M.
shrimp tacos.review: Came here for lunch on a weekday and loved everything I tried! The ambiance is fun with South American art pieces. I tried their eggplant tacos, shrimp tacos and the flower basket. All three were fantastically delicious. Sweet people to sweeten the deal.

excerpts: Shrimp tacos were awesome - flavorful, the right amount of spice, filling, and beautifully presented with a flower.
My husband had steak tacos and also really liked them.
shrimp tacos.author: Meg H.
shrimp tacos.review: Our group of 6 visited Chisme for dinner and loved it! Shrimp tacos were awesome - flavorful, the right amount of spice, filling, and beautifully presented with a flower. My husband had steak tacos and also really liked them. We ordered chips and guacamole (with pomegranate seeds on top - great idea), cauliflower ceviche, and mashed potatoes as sides. The ceviche was good, but I would prefer it made the original way with fish or shellfish instead of cauliflower. Mashed potatoes were delicious. We tried both red and white sangria, both excellent. We were excited to find this new restaurant!

excerpts: Mahi mahi tacos
- These were just ok
, I think the fruity salsa overpowered the flavor of the mahi mahi.
Jackfruit
tacos - Whatever topping they had (it was pink though..
Seasonal greens?
Sweet cabbage?) made the entire taco really tart.
Even after taking some of it out, it still tasted interesting to me...
We weren't huge fans of this one.
Pinchelotes - Really good.
They sure didn't jip on the cheesiness!
Guac and chips -
mahi mahi tacos.author: Jessica C.
mahi mahi tacos.review:
Visited from Seattle and decided to check out some restaurants in the area. I love tacos and always make it a point to get some every time I go on vacation! What struck me about Chisme was its peculiar menu. Jackfruit and eggplant tacos?! My interest was surely piqued. 

They were pretty busy for a Thursday night. It seems like a hipster/touristy place. We ordered the following:

Steak tacos - I really enjoyed the marinade, it was unique in a very good way. 
Mahi mahi tacos - These were just ok, I think the fruity salsa overpowered the flavor of the mahi mahi.
Jackfruit tacos - Whatever topping they had (it was pink though.. Seasonal greens? Sweet cabbage?) made the entire taco really tart. Even after taking some of it out, it still tasted interesting to me...  We weren't huge fans of this one. 
Pinchelotes - Really good. They sure didn't jip on the cheesiness!
Guac and chips - Extra chips are free!

Make sure to try the house hot sauce! It has a real nice kick to it, and it's sweet.

It's pretty expensive here. The tacos range from $8-12 for just 2 tacos and I'm pretty sure the pinchelotes were about $8-9 (seeing as how I usually get elote for $3.) It's one of those places where I'd go once just to try the cool menu.

excerpts: I've had the jackfruit tacos, mahi mahi tacos and their papas Rojas.
The portions are great and make sure to ask for their homemade spicy sauce.
mahi mahi tacos.author: Jack C.
mahi mahi tacos.review: I love this place! I've had the jackfruit tacos, mahi mahi tacos and their papas Rojas. The portions are great and make sure to ask for their homemade spicy sauce.

excerpts: the mahi mahi tacos are great.
full flavor from the fish and the toppings.
mahi mahi tacos.author: Nikole D.
mahi mahi tacos.review:
This was an Insta find while scrolling through bay area eats! super happy to have this crossed off the list. Great food, excellent service, and nice venue. 

first and foremost, the food. the mahi mahi tacos are great. full flavor from the fish and the toppings. the pineapple bits bring out the sweetness and the slaw and sauce carried the flavor of the fish making a mean taco. 

Also tried the quesadilla. if youre for the traditional super quesadilla, id veer left from this item. the reason being is that the meat is sauteed with red onions and other seasonings that focus the taste on the seasonings, rather than the meat. not bad or terrible, just not your typical tacqueria style. 

lastly dessert and drinks. the plantains are an interesting take. if youve had thai style fried banana then this isn't far from that. plantains have a natural sugar coat when fried, so this was a lot sweeter, but the vanilla ice cream calmed the sweetness down. the churros are stuffed wtih caramel, so be careful of sweetness overload. the cream that accompanies the churros is great! homemade and not too dense. 
if you still have room, get the horchata. its a vegan take on it and it is honestly such a refreshing drink to have with your meal. hope this helped. leave a line, or lets explore food!!!

excerpts: The mahi mahi tacos were the best, hands down.
mahi mahi tacos.author: Cabaca T.
mahi mahi tacos.review:
The tacos are nutritious, delicious and filling! Two orders and a side and you're good for a date night meal. The ingredients are fresh, the food is quick and perfectly cooked. The mahi mahi tacos were the best, hands down. 

Ordering the cauliflower ceviche, it was good (don't get me wrong) but the ingredients were simple and the idea of paying almost $10 for a bowl of raw cauliflower and spices was a little reality kick in the ass that you're paying San Francisco prices. 

Great place though, they should be getting sangria and wine soon.

excerpts:
I came here with a group of vegetarians and we ordered the following

- mahi mahi tacos (for me the only non veg person): 3.5/5

- plantain tacos: 2/5 not enough flavor.
mahi mahi tacos.author: Somya M.
mahi mahi tacos.review:
I came here with a group of vegetarians and we ordered the following

- mahi mahi tacos (for me the only non veg person): 3.5/5

- plantain tacos: 2/5 not enough flavor. Flavors didn't make sense together. I've had delicious plantain tacos with black beans, cilantro and hot sauce. These just didn't land.

- eggplant tacos: 3/5 the fried eggplant was good, tacos were again seriously lacking in flavor (and salt)

- cauliflower ceviche: 1/5 this item is 99% branding. It's literally raw riced cauliflower in lime juice. Not good.

- death via ginger: 2/5 way too sweet to be "medicinal" as claimed on the menu

I had really high hopes for this place, but the food was not good and the service was also a 2/5. Would not reccommend.

excerpts: The mahi mahi tacos are some of the best fish tacos money can buy and the shrimp tacos are no joke either.
The churros are delicious and decadent.
Fantastic beer selection from San Francisco's own Barebottle Brewery, and the people behind the counter are always friendly.
mahi mahi tacos.author: Troy H.
mahi mahi tacos.review: Chisme is an outstanding addition to the neighborhood. The mahi mahi tacos are some of the best fish tacos money can buy and the shrimp tacos are no joke either. The churros are delicious and decadent. Fantastic beer selection from San Francisco's own Barebottle Brewery, and the people behind the counter are always friendly.

excerpts: First, I ordered 2 eggplant tacos.
I added guacamole for an extra dollar.
The taco was honestly full of flavor!
I didn't really have much complaints other than I wished the guacamole was evenly distributed
lol
I felt like it was just a big blob.
The amount of guacamole was also a little too much.. but who am I to complain?
More is better than less.
I couldn't finish my two tacos because I was so full from eating their chips & salsa- which was also very delicious!
I loved their red and green salsa.
Their green salsa was so creamy and spicy.
Additionally, my boyfriend ordered a mahi-mahi taco and he liked it as well.
eggplant tacos.author: Tanya D.
eggplant tacos.review:
I've had this bookmarked on my "must-try vegan spots" for quite awhile now. Today, I finally decided to try it out! Honestly so surprised how vegan tacos can taste so good. 

First, I ordered 2 eggplant tacos. I added guacamole for an extra dollar. The taco was honestly full of flavor! I didn't really have much complaints other than I wished the guacamole was evenly distributed lol I felt like it was just a big blob. The amount of guacamole was also a little too much.. but who am I to complain? More is better than less. I couldn't finish my two tacos because I was so full from eating their chips & salsa- which was also very delicious! I loved their red and green salsa. Their green salsa was so creamy and spicy. Additionally, my boyfriend ordered a mahi-mahi taco and he liked it as well. Also, we ordered coconut horchata and they were boooombbb!

Secondly, the service was great! All staff were kind and helpful :)

Last, I loved loved the atmosphere. The lights were purposely on the dark side and it made me a little sleepy lmao. I was so full that I was about to pass out in the restaurant.

Overall, my total was $41 which is a little expensive but it was worth it for the experience! Definitely recommend!

excerpts: My friend LOVED the peanut mole in the eggplant tacos.
eggplant tacos.author: Su Lin Y.
eggplant tacos.review:
Hands down the best tacos I had outside of Mexico. 

I love this place!!! You know when you eat something and you feel all nourished and happy and wholesome? That's how I felt after having the food at Chisme. Ingredients were really fresh, and the even the fried food wasn't too greasy. Everything was just absolutely delicious, and perfect and I felt satiated and satisfied and very happy. 

I'm not vegan, but my friend and I thought the vegan options sounded delicious, so we got the eggplant and jackfruit tacos. Best decision ever. It's so delicious, it just doesn't cross your mind that you're eating something vegan. The combinations of toppings also went so well, and might I say the hot sauce also had just the right amount of heat. My friend LOVED the peanut mole in the eggplant tacos. (Tip: it's on the steak tacos as well!)

We had an early dinner around 5.30pm, and knowing myself, I knew I'd be hungry by around 8pm, so I got a box of steak tacos and cauliflower ceviche to go (recommended by the lovely lady at the counter). I personally preferred the vegan tacos to the steak tacos, but they were also so good. Cauliflower ceviche came with fresh, warm, chips. The whole combination was to die for. The ceviche was so incredibly refreshing, the perfect late evening snack I wanted! 

Also ate pinchelotes... and I love corn, so that was good too.

Everything everything EVERYTHING was good. You can't go wrong here :) (the only thing I didn't love was the coconut horchata, I thought it was too sweet for me)

excerpts: Got to try the eggplant tacos which were filled with a crispy, fried eggplant, mole, spinach and onions- filling yet light enough to enjoy some churros too!
eggplant tacos.author: Roma R.
eggplant tacos.review:
Thrilled yet again!! Got to try the eggplant tacos which were filled with a crispy, fried eggplant, mole, spinach and onions- filling yet light enough to enjoy some churros too! We also tried the papas rojas... the sauce on top was absolutely delectable.
Made the right choice this time, and I skipped the beer for the refreshing horchata!

excerpts: Jackfruit and eggplant tacos?!
eggplant tacos.author: Jessica C.
eggplant tacos.review:
Visited from Seattle and decided to check out some restaurants in the area. I love tacos and always make it a point to get some every time I go on vacation! What struck me about Chisme was its peculiar menu. Jackfruit and eggplant tacos?! My interest was surely piqued. 

They were pretty busy for a Thursday night. It seems like a hipster/touristy place. We ordered the following:

Steak tacos - I really enjoyed the marinade, it was unique in a very good way. 
Mahi mahi tacos - These were just ok, I think the fruity salsa overpowered the flavor of the mahi mahi.
Jackfruit tacos - Whatever topping they had (it was pink though.. Seasonal greens? Sweet cabbage?) made the entire taco really tart. Even after taking some of it out, it still tasted interesting to me...  We weren't huge fans of this one. 
Pinchelotes - Really good. They sure didn't jip on the cheesiness!
Guac and chips - Extra chips are free!

Make sure to try the house hot sauce! It has a real nice kick to it, and it's sweet.

It's pretty expensive here. The tacos range from $8-12 for just 2 tacos and I'm pretty sure the pinchelotes were about $8-9 (seeing as how I usually get elote for $3.) It's one of those places where I'd go once just to try the cool menu.

excerpts: I visited Chisme last night with a friend (who happens to be a vegan) and we ended up getting 1 order of jackfruit tacos, 1 order of eggplant tacos, and the guac.
The jackfruit tacos were the highlight of the night.
I love me some pork, but I would gladly swap my carnitas for this forever (ok, maybe 80% of the time).
The eggplant tacos were a-okay, a little difficult to eat honestly (maybe the eggplants need to be chopped into smaller pieces?) but they tasted good.
Overall, I had a great experience at Chisme and I will definitely be coming back for the jackfruit tacos.
eggplant tacos.author: Rafaella S.
eggplant tacos.review:
When I noticed a new Mexican restaurant had popped up merely a block away from where I live, I was really excited to give it a try... and then I noticed the menu is vegan-friendly and my mind exploded a little (I'm not a vegan but I do like to eat plant-based foods on some days to give my system a break).

I visited Chisme last night with a friend (who happens to be a vegan) and we ended up getting 1 order of jackfruit tacos, 1 order of eggplant tacos, and the guac.

The jackfruit tacos were the highlight of the night. I love me some pork, but I would gladly swap my carnitas for this forever (ok, maybe 80% of the time). If only other joints served jackfruit, there would be more vegans in the world.

The eggplant tacos were a-okay, a little difficult to eat honestly (maybe the eggplants need to be chopped into smaller pieces?) but they tasted good. The guac wasn't anything special and I wish the tortillas came separately.

Overall, I had a great experience at Chisme and I will definitely be coming back for the jackfruit tacos.

-

Now a couple of suggestions for the restaurant owner:

Please serve food on actual plates; there is no reason for food to be served on disposable plates when this is a sit-in restaurant. It's wasteful and SF is all about being ecofriendly. 

Please allow for a mix and match type order for the tacos. I really wanted to try other flavors but the orders come with 2 tacos. The tacos are pretty expensive, so I think being more flexible about this would compensate for the price.

I would suggest a better presentation for the guacamole and chips (definitely more chips). I think having real plates would solve that problem.

Thank you for opening up a vegan-friendly restaurant in my neighborhood!

excerpts:
Vegetarian and vegan friendly

Personally not huge on the jackfruit but the eggplant tacos were amazing.
eggplant tacos.author: Crystal F.
eggplant tacos.review:
Love this spot. It's fresh with quality ingredients. 
For those that like heat, their house hot sauce is killer but flavorful.

1. Vegetarian and vegan friendly

Personally not huge on the jackfruit but the eggplant tacos were amazing. Breaded eggplant with peanut mole. Recommending adding the guacamole on top.

The mashed potato bowl is delicious and comforting

The quesadilla is one of my favorites in the city. The tortilla is super light and flaky, just perfect!

2. Beverages

There's a selection of wine and beer. For those who like strong ginger drinks, they have a great ginger tonic that packs a punch. 

3. Dessert

Had the caramel churros with chocolate sauce and home made whipped cream. Definitely worth saving room to have this.

excerpts: The most filling and tasty eggplant Tacos I've ever had.
An amazing vegetarian option in a sunny Lower Nob Hill neighborhood.
I was surprised, exclaiming "holy shit" to myself.
A great addition that is sure to grow with everyone living here.
eggplant tacos.author: Mark C.
eggplant tacos.review: The most filling and tasty eggplant Tacos I've ever had. An amazing vegetarian option in a sunny Lower Nob Hill neighborhood. I was surprised, exclaiming "holy shit" to myself. A great addition that is sure to grow with everyone living here.

excerpts: I tried their eggplant tacos, shrimp tacos and the flower basket.
All three were fantastically delicious.
Sweet people to sweeten the deal.
eggplant tacos.author: Jake M.
eggplant tacos.review: Came here for lunch on a weekday and loved everything I tried! The ambiance is fun with South American art pieces. I tried their eggplant tacos, shrimp tacos and the flower basket. All three were fantastically delicious. Sweet people to sweeten the deal.

excerpts: I know the whole deal here is tacos, but I had a plantain quesadilla.
It was pretty good!
And bigger than I thought it was gonna be.
(I thought it was going to be feeble.
plantain quesadilla.author: Jim M.
plantain quesadilla.review:
A new(ish) taco joint on a stretch of Sutter that is... weird. A couple really great greasy spoons. A coffee shop or two. Some hair stylists. A fortune teller. An art gallery. Liloliho. A book store that is definitely owned and operated by a wizard-in-hiding. And a gold dealer? OK, Sutter. 

Anyway, nice to have a place to eat that isn't closed by 3pm or Liloliho Yacht Club. 

Big, "fast casual-y" interior where you can sit comfortably, but not for too long. Speedy service. 

I know the whole deal here is tacos, but I had a plantain quesadilla. It was pretty good! And bigger than I thought it was gonna be. (I thought it was going to be feeble. Sorry for doubting you, Chisme.) 

Came with three "housemade salsas", one of which was sour cream. Don't get me wrong, I was glad of the sour cream and ate all of it but I'm not 100% sure it counts. 

A ton of vegan options on the menu, which was nice, but nothing specifically vegetarian. I guess you could just order a vegan thing and ask for real cheese and sour cream on it, but that was a level of social interaction with my server I wasn't prepared to have.

excerpts: I'd recommend the shrimp or skirt steak tacos.
skirt steak tacos.author: Rhett B.
skirt steak tacos.review: Visiting Chismse Cantina for the first time on Sutter Street today. It's easily identifiable due to the teal doors, blue gate, and awning in front. It's a small business with reasonable rustic seating options and friendly staff. It's expensive for the Quantity of food you receive, but, the food is good. I'd recommend the shrimp or skirt steak tacos. I ordered the shrimp tacos (which only came with 2) and chips and guac which totaled over $20. Again, its a good place and worth trying. Just be prepared for the sticker price!

excerpts: Greeted by a huge smile, we gathered some information about the menu before deciding on the skirt steak tacos ($11), the shrimp tacos ($10), and the cauliflower ceviche ($7).
The food was out in a prompt fashion, and our taste buds lit up when we took our first bite.
Holy moly peanut butter MOLE.
These flavors WORK.
Every bite was just like the first - magical.
Adding the lime wedge to the cauliflower ceviche gave it an acidity that perfect the dish, and the staff brought more chips as soon as we finished the first batch.
skirt steak tacos.author: Hannah S.
skirt steak tacos.review:
Taco Tuesday anyone?? This place is as good as it gets! Walking in, I felt instantly calmed by the beautiful details of the place; the Fnnch mural, the simplistic light fixtures, the 'magic' pink water... Everything in there made me want to stay.

Greeted by a huge smile, we gathered some information about the menu before deciding on the skirt steak tacos ($11), the shrimp tacos ($10), and the cauliflower ceviche ($7). The food was out in a prompt fashion, and our taste buds lit up when we took our first bite. Holy moly peanut butter MOLE. These flavors WORK. Every bite was just like the first - magical. Adding the lime wedge to the cauliflower ceviche gave it an acidity that perfect the dish, and the staff brought more chips as soon as we finished the first batch.

We were so blown away that we decided to go in for dessert as well. We had a hard time deciding between the Sweet Chimichanga ($7) and the Caramel Churros ($7). However, we had no regrets when our caramel stuffed churros arrived with the sweetest, homemade whipped cream. Every.Damn.Bite was incredible. I have never enjoyed a churro so wholeheartedly.

So yes, come here. This is a humble restaurant serving some of the best damn food around at a totally affordable place. I am #blessed to live just around the corner and will be a frequent visitor here!

excerpts: I came here for lunch today with my girlfriend and we had the jackfruit tacos, skirt steak tacos, an order of the elote, and a horchata to share.
skirt steak tacos.author: Austin W.
skirt steak tacos.review:
I came here for lunch today with my girlfriend and we had the jackfruit tacos, skirt steak tacos, an order of the elote, and a horchata to share. To get straight to the point, everything was delicious, the decor of the restaurant looks fantastic, and the woman at the counter couldn't have been nicer. 

Of the two different types of tacos we ordered, I personally like the jackfruit one a tiny bit more; the mint verde that was lathered on top of the cabbage in the taco was my favorite part of the taco. Our only criticism with the skirt steak taco is that the meat itself could've been cut a bit more, into smaller bit size pieces. With how the meat is cut right now, there's a good chance your first bite pulls out the entire piece of meat, leaving you with a meatless taco. Be sure to grab extra napkins for the skirt steak taco too! The (delicious) mole sauce is going to be dripping all over your hands once you're through with the taco. Overall, both tacos were carefully thought out in composition and I can definitely appreciate that.

If you've never had elote before, be sure to order one at Chisme! There are few things better than cheese on a cob of corn on a stick. You won't regret it.

Reading through the other Yelp reviews, it seems like people's primary criticism of Chisme is that the prices are too high, and that you can't mix and match the tacos. I disagree on both these points. The prices are perfectly reasonable for what you're getting, and you'll definitely be full after having an order of tacos. Not specific to Chisme, but to all restaurants in general: if the restaurant publishes its prices (which Chisme does), if you're unhappy with the pricing, just don't go; nobody's forcing you to. Re: mixing and matching, I've got a solution for you: come with a friend! Just order two and share :)

5/5 experience, definitely coming back to Chisme.

excerpts: 2x Skirt Steak Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)
skirt steak tacos.author: Kaje Y.
skirt steak tacos.review:
As my yelp buddies and I were in search of our next date night, Chisme was recommended. I skipped the yelp newsletter that featured Chisme, but alas, our dinner location was set.

We entered into a fairly large area. We observed that it's an order-first-then-sit-down type of place. Along the wall are a few cute... bears? (They're also at he Union Square Ice Rink). 

While waiting for the group, I started with a Panda Petals Saison. It was pretty tasty! 

When the group got here, this was what we decided on:

2x Shrimp Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)
2x Skirt Steak Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)
2x Pulled Chicken Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)

2x Papas Rojas
1x Guac and Chips
2x Pinchelotes (Corn on the cob - 2 per order)
1x Cauliflower Civiche

Our general consensus was Steak, Shrimp, Chicken in that order. I personally LOVED the flavours in the shrimp taco. 

We initially only ordered 1 papas rojas, but decided it was yummy enough to get another order! The cauliflower civiche, while a bit odd in theory, worked pretty well, however it was missing a little something that I can't put my finger on.

The guac was spot on, and the pinchelotes were quite good. Personally, I'd love more it if it had a hint of garlic on it!

I spent some time talking to the owner on the thought process of establishing this place. He had an idea for each dish and how it should taste. There was one dish we wanted to try, but he took it off the menu due to it coming out a little inconsistent. That tells you a lot of what this place is trying to offer. There's also a lack of arrogance and he seems to be customer focused.

Overall, this place does well and is heading in the right direction. I was really happy with the dishes. I really look forward to an updated menu in a few months to see if any other unique dishes pop up to try. 

I'll be back, to try all the beers, and definitely for more steak and shrimp tacos!

excerpts: The skirt steak tacos and quesadilla are delicious Everything I ordered from the starters to dessert was super yummy
and I left with a full and happy tummy :)
skirt steak tacos.author: Sophie. D.
skirt steak tacos.review: This place for one, is so cute inside ! The decor is so cute and the place is nice and clean :)) As for the food, AMAZING! The skirt steak tacos and quesadilla are delicious Everything I ordered from the starters to dessert was super yummy and I left with a full and happy tummy :)

excerpts: Maybe it was just this one incident, since there are such good reviews on this place, but I felt like the skirt steak tacos I ordered was a really bland.
The steak was cooked well
but I had to add at least 2 pinches of salt to each taco.
The tacos definitely looked tasty, but I was a little surprised
skirt steak tacos.author: Vivy S.
skirt steak tacos.review:
Such a cute place and the colorful storefront definitely caught my eye so I wanted to check it out.

Maybe it was just this one incident, since there are such good reviews on this place, but I felt like the skirt steak tacos I ordered was a really bland. The steak was cooked well but I had to add at least 2 pinches of salt to each taco. The tacos definitely looked tasty, but I was a little surprised I had to add salt to taste, especially when I'm not one to add much salt to my food usually. 

The website boasts "affordable and contemporary Mexican-inspired cuisine," however, I wasn't impressed by my $8 guacamole and chips. There were only 14 chips intricately placed in the guacamole, which tasted very fresh. I just didn't see how 14 chips in guacamole with a flower in the middle served in a paper bowl served for here could be justified. They charged an extra $2.75 for extra chips as well. 

I'm hoping it was just a one time incident in regards to bland tacos. As far as price goes, I think the chips and guacamole were a little overpriced. At least offer more chips and present the chips and guacamole in actual porcelain/ceramic bowls if you're going to charge that much. I could purchase a whole bag of chips for the price of adding more chips to the 14-chips I received... 

Regardless, I do love that Chisme offers good vibes and a fresh take on Mexican food... The Counter seating by the window would definitely be a great spot to people watch. 

I'm a full supporter of all the restaurants popping up in our Tendernob neighborhood. Hence, I'm hoping this review would be seen more constructively so I could continue to show some love to the growing Tendernob family community of restaurants and bars.

excerpts: My husband had the skirt steak tacos and loved them!
Great choices for vegans and carnivores alike.
What a gem!
skirt steak tacos.author: Christeen M.
skirt steak tacos.review: Absolutely amazing place! Walked in and it was roomy and had plenty of seating. The sweet ladies at the counter had the best customer service and the kindest smiles (two things that I appreciate immensely!). The plantain tacos were insane. Mango salsa was fresh. My husband had the skirt steak tacos and loved them! Great choices for vegans and carnivores alike. What a gem!

excerpts: so we got the eggplant and jackfruit tacos.
Best decision ever.
It's so delicious
, it just doesn't cross your mind that you're eating something vegan.

I love this place!!! You know when you eat something and you feel all nourished and happy and wholesome? That's how I felt after having the food at Chisme. Ingredients were really fresh, and the even the fried food wasn't too greasy. Everything was just absolutely delicious, and perfect and I felt satiated and satisfied and very happy. 

I'm not vegan, but my friend and I thought the vegan options sounded delicious, so we got the eggplant and jackfruit tacos. Best decision ever. It's so delicious, it just doesn't cross your mind that you're eating something vegan. The combinations of toppings also went so well, and might I say the hot sauce also had just the right amount of heat. My friend LOVED the peanut mole in the eggplant tacos. (Tip: it's on the steak tacos as well!)

We had an early dinner around 5.30pm, and knowing myself, I knew I'd be hungry by around 8pm, so I got a box of steak tacos and cauliflower ceviche to go (recommended by the lovely lady at the counter). I personally preferred the vegan tacos to the steak tacos, but they were also so good. Cauliflower ceviche came with fresh, warm, chips. The whole combination was to die for. The ceviche was so incredibly refreshing, the perfect late evening snack I wanted! 

Also ate pinchelotes... and I love corn, so that was good too.

Everything everything EVERYTHING was good. You can't go wrong here :) (the only thing I didn't love was the coconut horchata, I thought it was too sweet for me)

excerpts: I came here for lunch today with my girlfriend and we had the jackfruit tacos, skirt steak tacos, an order of the elote, and a horchata to share.
jackfruit tacos.author: Austin W.
jackfruit tacos.review:
I came here for lunch today with my girlfriend and we had the jackfruit tacos, skirt steak tacos, an order of the elote, and a horchata to share. To get straight to the point, everything was delicious, the decor of the restaurant looks fantastic, and the woman at the counter couldn't have been nicer. 

Of the two different types of tacos we ordered, I personally like the jackfruit one a tiny bit more; the mint verde that was lathered on top of the cabbage in the taco was my favorite part of the taco. Our only criticism with the skirt steak taco is that the meat itself could've been cut a bit more, into smaller bit size pieces. With how the meat is cut right now, there's a good chance your first bite pulls out the entire piece of meat, leaving you with a meatless taco. Be sure to grab extra napkins for the skirt steak taco too! The (delicious) mole sauce is going to be dripping all over your hands once you're through with the taco. Overall, both tacos were carefully thought out in composition and I can definitely appreciate that.

If you've never had elote before, be sure to order one at Chisme! There are few things better than cheese on a cob of corn on a stick. You won't regret it.

Reading through the other Yelp reviews, it seems like people's primary criticism of Chisme is that the prices are too high, and that you can't mix and match the tacos. I disagree on both these points. The prices are perfectly reasonable for what you're getting, and you'll definitely be full after having an order of tacos. Not specific to Chisme, but to all restaurants in general: if the restaurant publishes its prices (which Chisme does), if you're unhappy with the pricing, just don't go; nobody's forcing you to. Re: mixing and matching, I've got a solution for you: come with a friend! Just order two and share :)

5/5 experience, definitely coming back to Chisme.

excerpts: For dinner, we had the Via Via (Fried Plaintain) tacos and the Jackfruit tacos.
jackfruit tacos.author: Lanie L.
jackfruit tacos.review:
When I found out that a new taco shop opened up in the 'hood, my interest perked.

When I found out that they had vegan options, (not just a one or two but at least half the menu is vegan-friendly!) I knew I had to try it out asap. (That fiery 'Hot & New' business flame only lasts so long!)

Located off Sutter & Leavenworth, it mirrors power-player Liholiho and the faux-bougie corporate l*ser Papa John's. If I lived in the direct area, I'd be happy to see this new affordable, fresh, and delicious restaurant opening up.

Reading the reviews, it seems like a lot of Yelpers are complaining about the "expensive prices" of these tacos. Come on people, have you not been to Tacolicious or Nick's Crispy Tacos? This is not your average hole-in-the-wall taqueria. As much as I love my $2 tacos filled with beans and rice, this place offers a more modern take on Mexican cuisine with eclectic ingredients. Could you find fried plantain tacos at a standard taqueria? Don't think so. The diverse ingredients equate to a slightly higher price, but I don't believe it is priced exorbitantly. 

For dinner, we had the Via Via (Fried Plaintain) tacos and the Jackfruit tacos. We also had the Papas Rojas with Mole Sauce, and draft beer to round the meal out.

Both tacos were delicious! The Fried plaintains were paired with refried black beans which were a delicious blend of sweet & savory. They fried the jackfruit, which gave it a crunchy texture. This paired very nicely with their fresh greens and mint verde. The mole sauce on the papas rojas was so good! Crispy potatoes topped with a savory white sauce. Yum! 
Also, don't forget about their spicy green salsa. It definitely has a kick to it!

They offer bottled beer and wine, but we opted for the draft. I forgot what the brand of beer it was, but we went for the Cascade Sunshine, which is a light IPA. It paired very nicely with our meal.

If I had to nitpick something, I wish we could mix & match tacos. Since all the vegan tacos are $8 for 2, maybe at least we could mix and match the vegan options? Or maybe mix and match, but reflect the price of the higher priced taco. [Ex: Someone buys a steak & shrimp taco, it would still be $11 for the two].

Overall, Chisme offers delicious tacos in a cozy environment at a decent price. I applaud the extensive vegan options and bold flavors not usually seen at a standard taqueria. I will be back again soon!

excerpts: I've had the jackfruit tacos, mahi mahi tacos and their papas Rojas.

jackfruit tacos.review: This place is great for vegans. I would especially recommend it for people with a large party because their long tables and small plates make for a great "tapas" style meal. They also have sangrias and great coconut horchatas. I've loved all of their food so far, especially their jackfruit tacos. Staff is incredibly nice. I can't stop coming back here, especially when it's a bit less crowded during the day.

excerpts: I visited Chisme last night with a friend (who happens to be a vegan) and we ended up getting 1 order of jackfruit tacos, 1 order of eggplant tacos, and the guac.
The jackfruit tacos were the highlight of the night.
I love me some pork, but I would gladly swap my carnitas for this forever (ok, maybe 80% of the time).
The eggplant tacos were a-okay, a little difficult to eat honestly (maybe the eggplants need to be chopped into smaller pieces?) but they tasted good.
Overall, I had a great experience at Chisme and I will definitely be coming back for the jackfruit tacos.
jackfruit tacos.author: Rafaella S.
jackfruit tacos.review:
When I noticed a new Mexican restaurant had popped up merely a block away from where I live, I was really excited to give it a try... and then I noticed the menu is vegan-friendly and my mind exploded a little (I'm not a vegan but I do like to eat plant-based foods on some days to give my system a break).

I visited Chisme last night with a friend (who happens to be a vegan) and we ended up getting 1 order of jackfruit tacos, 1 order of eggplant tacos, and the guac.

The jackfruit tacos were the highlight of the night. I love me some pork, but I would gladly swap my carnitas for this forever (ok, maybe 80% of the time). If only other joints served jackfruit, there would be more vegans in the world.

The eggplant tacos were a-okay, a little difficult to eat honestly (maybe the eggplants need to be chopped into smaller pieces?) but they tasted good. The guac wasn't anything special and I wish the tortillas came separately.

Overall, I had a great experience at Chisme and I will definitely be coming back for the jackfruit tacos.

-

Now a couple of suggestions for the restaurant owner:

Please serve food on actual plates; there is no reason for food to be served on disposable plates when this is a sit-in restaurant. It's wasteful and SF is all about being ecofriendly. 

Please allow for a mix and match type order for the tacos. I really wanted to try other flavors but the orders come with 2 tacos. The tacos are pretty expensive, so I think being more flexible about this would compensate for the price.

I would suggest a better presentation for the guacamole and chips (definitely more chips). I think having real plates would solve that problem.

Thank you for opening up a vegan-friendly restaurant in my neighborhood!

excerpts: The cauliflower ceviche was unique but I can't say I was blown away.
cauliflower ceviche.author: Spartevan V.
cauliflower ceviche.review:
I was rolling solo for lunch, which is the perfect (and by all estimations - the ONLY time) to indulge in corn on the cob. Or, elotes in this case. 

The number of times you (irrespective of gender) should ever order corn on the cob while in the company of others is zero. You look like a damn toothless fool for half of the ordeal, and are foolishly picking corn out of your damn teeth for the other half. Unattractive. 

Alas, this isn't just any corn on the cob, they are elotes. Smothered in cotija cheese, slathered in mayo, drizzled with lime. Some varietals (not found on the Chisme menu) come in a cup, which negates my statements above. 

The cauliflower ceviche was unique but I can't say I was blown away. Of course, in re-reading this sentence, it's glaringly clear why, but I am always up for low carb/calorie novelty. 

In sum: Go alone. Remove the paper bag from your head. Order elotes. Enjoy.

excerpts: Greeted by a huge smile, we gathered some information about the menu before deciding on the skirt steak tacos ($11), the shrimp tacos ($10), and the cauliflower ceviche ($7).
The food was out in a prompt fashion, and our taste buds lit up when we took our first bite.
Holy moly peanut butter MOLE.
These flavors WORK.
Every bite was just like the first - magical.
Adding the lime wedge to the cauliflower ceviche gave it an acidity that perfect the dish, and the staff brought more chips as soon as we finished the first batch.
cauliflower ceviche.author: Hannah S.
cauliflower ceviche.review:
Taco Tuesday anyone?? This place is as good as it gets! Walking in, I felt instantly calmed by the beautiful details of the place; the Fnnch mural, the simplistic light fixtures, the 'magic' pink water... Everything in there made me want to stay.

Greeted by a huge smile, we gathered some information about the menu before deciding on the skirt steak tacos ($11), the shrimp tacos ($10), and the cauliflower ceviche ($7). The food was out in a prompt fashion, and our taste buds lit up when we took our first bite. Holy moly peanut butter MOLE. These flavors WORK. Every bite was just like the first - magical. Adding the lime wedge to the cauliflower ceviche gave it an acidity that perfect the dish, and the staff brought more chips as soon as we finished the first batch.

We were so blown away that we decided to go in for dessert as well. We had a hard time deciding between the Sweet Chimichanga ($7) and the Caramel Churros ($7). However, we had no regrets when our caramel stuffed churros arrived with the sweetest, homemade whipped cream. Every.Damn.Bite was incredible. I have never enjoyed a churro so wholeheartedly.

So yes, come here. This is a humble restaurant serving some of the best damn food around at a totally affordable place. I am #blessed to live just around the corner and will be a frequent visitor here!

excerpts:
cauliflower ceviche
-- horchata 
-- churros
cauliflower ceviche.author: Capers B.
cauliflower ceviche.review:
I've now been here four or five times and have to say I'm a big fan of this place. I'm not vegan, or even vegetarian, but I love trying new foods. This menu certainly succeeds at honoring traditional flavors while offering alternatives for those who may have dietary restrictions. My favorite items on the menu are the:

-- plantain tacos
-- cauliflower ceviche
-- horchata 
-- churros

The decor is nice and there's plenty of seating. It can get packed on a Saturday night so stick to week nights if you can. 

 The only reason why I've taken off one star is for the price. Twenty bucks for two tacos and a side is a lot, especially when there are so many great options for $10 in the city. 

That being said, it's cute and delicious. I'll keep giving them my money.

excerpts: The cauliflower ceviche was also delicious.
As someone who recently started eating more of a plant based diet, I definitely find myself missing some of my favorite foods.
While definitely not the same as real ceviche, this cauliflower ceviche definitely hit the spot with the lime juice and jalapeño flavors.
cauliflower ceviche.author: Paul W.
cauliflower ceviche.review:
The mark of a good restaurant is finding yourself craving the food a few weeks later.  I stopped by Chisme with a few friends after seeing a show nearby.  Finding solid vegan food has been more difficult than I would imagine in San Francisco, but Chisme had a few tacos and other menu items that are vegan.  

The vegan tacos are jackfruit, eggplant, and plantain. All three were delicious. I think maybe the eggplant was my favorite as the breaded and fried crispy pieces of eggplant were crunchy and delicious. 

The cauliflower ceviche was also delicious. As someone who recently started eating more of a plant based diet, I definitely find myself missing some of my favorite foods. While definitely not the same as real ceviche, this cauliflower ceviche definitely hit the spot with the lime juice and jalapeño flavors. 

The staff was extremely friendly and attentive, the place was clean, and the decor was nice. 

I will definitely be back!

excerpts: Cauliflower ceviche
I would skip-
not very flavorful.
I haven't tried any of the desserts, but will make a point to leave some room next time!
cauliflower ceviche.author: Peggy L.
cauliflower ceviche.review:
I live less than a block away from Chisme and this has become my go to taco spot. I've tried a number of them and they are all unique, gorgeous, and delicious. 

-Chicken demi da: my go to taco with yummy mole and shredded chicken
-Shrimp: love the mango salsa they use, with a generous amount of shrimp
-Mahi: tropical with coconut and pineapple, good piece of fish in each taco. 
-Jackfruit: I've never had jackfruit before and it was a very unique taste that I was not use to. I prefer the meat tacos, but my vegan friends thought this was incredible 
-Via Via- You can't ever go wrong with fried plantain

Their guac was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. I love their spicy homemade salsa- but be warned- it's very spicy. Pinchelotes was a little expensive but covered in cheesy goodness. Cauliflower ceviche I would skip- not very flavorful. I haven't tried any of the desserts, but will make a point to leave some room next time!

excerpts: They also have an amazing vegan cauliflower ceviche, a super tasty poblano mashed potato, the poblano pepper (not spicy)
totally make it very unique.
And of course the

"Pinchelotes" makes me feel like if I'm in Mexico City, They also have Churrossss con salsa de Chocolate caliente so yummy, plus they always have great spanish music , the service is very friendly and kind.
Go try Chisme!!!
cauliflower ceviche.author: Michelle C.
cauliflower ceviche.review: This place is probably my favorite Mexican restaurant in USA, very authentic. I'm half Mexican and when we are talking about MEXICAN TASTING, I am very picky (just because I love Mexican food) I will say that the mole sauce is pretty much as amazing as the one my grandma made, Shrimp Tacos with the Mango salsa, mole and queso fresco is definitely my favorite, The Via Via (vegan) or Plantain Tacos is my second favorite choice, with the coconut ranch sooo good! They also have an amazing vegan cauliflower ceviche, a super tasty poblano mashed potato, the poblano pepper (not spicy) totally make it very unique. And of course the  "Pinchelotes" makes me feel like if I'm in Mexico City, They also have Churrossss con salsa de Chocolate caliente so yummy, plus they always have great spanish music , the service is very friendly and kind. Go try Chisme!!!

and I will definitely be back!

Also had the chips and cauliflower ceviche, which was really good -- sorta like coleslaw but healthier. Highly recommend and I will definitely be back!

cauliflower ceviche.author: Pratiksha S.
cauliflower ceviche.review: One of the best tacos and great service. Jackfruit tacos and cauliflower ceviche is a must!! Value for money

excerpts: Ordering the cauliflower ceviche, it was good
cauliflower ceviche.author: Cabaca T.
cauliflower ceviche.review:
The tacos are nutritious, delicious and filling! Two orders and a side and you're good for a date night meal. The ingredients are fresh, the food is quick and perfectly cooked. The mahi mahi tacos were the best, hands down. 

Ordering the cauliflower ceviche, it was good (don't get me wrong) but the ingredients were simple and the idea of paying almost $10 for a bowl of raw cauliflower and spices was a little reality kick in the ass that you're paying San Francisco prices. 

Great place though, they should be getting sangria and wine soon.

excerpts:
3/5 the fried eggplant was good, tacos were again seriously lacking in flavor (and salt)

- cauliflower ceviche: 1/5 this item is 99% branding.
cauliflower ceviche.author: Somya M.
cauliflower ceviche.review:
I came here with a group of vegetarians and we ordered the following

- mahi mahi tacos (for me the only non veg person): 3.5/5

- plantain tacos: 2/5 not enough flavor. Flavors didn't make sense together. I've had delicious plantain tacos with black beans, cilantro and hot sauce. These just didn't land.

- eggplant tacos: 3/5 the fried eggplant was good, tacos were again seriously lacking in flavor (and salt)

- cauliflower ceviche: 1/5 this item is 99% branding. It's literally raw riced cauliflower in lime juice. Not good.

- death via ginger: 2/5 way too sweet to be "medicinal" as claimed on the menu

I had really high hopes for this place, but the food was not good and the service was also a 2/5. Would not reccommend.

excerpts: The Cauliflower Ceviche was good, it had a coconut flavor, tastes tropical I would rate the Ceviche a 6 out of ten.
The food is good, the taco shop order at the counter concept combined with the prices could use some work....
cauliflower ceviche.author: Angel F.
cauliflower ceviche.review: Good food not great, just a bit overpriced. I paid $5 for a Coconut Milk Horchata which was okay nothing amazing it came in like a 12 ounce plastic cup, and I was not offered a free refill:( .... The tacos I ordered were really good though, I got the plantain black bean veggie tacos and they were a 9 out of ten.  The Cauliflower Ceviche was good, it had a coconut flavor, tastes tropical I would rate the Ceviche a 6 out of ten. The food is good, the taco shop order at the counter concept combined with the prices could use some work....

excerpts: Cauliflower Ceviche was amazing.
Excited to try more things on the menu.
Cute atmosphere.
cauliflower ceviche.author: Dominique G.
cauliflower ceviche.review: Cauliflower Ceviche was amazing. Excited to try more things on the menu. Cute atmosphere.
