I wouldn't get it again.
The tacos I ordered however were AMAZING!
cauliflower ceviche.author: Stephany D.
cauliflower ceviche.review: Cool vibe and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I got the cauliflower ceviche which was honestly kind of bland. I wouldn't get it again. The tacos I ordered however were AMAZING!

excerpts: We ordered chips and guacamole (with pomegranate seeds on top - great idea), cauliflower ceviche, and mashed potatoes as sides.
The ceviche was good, but I would prefer it made the original way with fish or shellfish instead of cauliflower.
Mashed potatoes were delicious.
We tried both red and white sangria, both excellent.
We were excited to find this new restaurant!
cauliflower ceviche.author: Meg H.
cauliflower ceviche.review: Our group of 6 visited Chisme for dinner and loved it! Shrimp tacos were awesome - flavorful, the right amount of spice, filling, and beautifully presented with a flower. My husband had steak tacos and also really liked them. We ordered chips and guacamole (with pomegranate seeds on top - great idea), cauliflower ceviche, and mashed potatoes as sides. The ceviche was good, but I would prefer it made the original way with fish or shellfish instead of cauliflower. Mashed potatoes were delicious. We tried both red and white sangria, both excellent. We were excited to find this new restaurant!

excerpts: My favorite thing we had was a toss between the Pinchelote and Flower Basket!!!
Need to go back asap for these bomb dishes!!!!
pinchelote.author: Ambz C.
pinchelote.review: My friend Emilie and I came in to Chisme, late night, the other day. We live in the neighborhood and have been waiting for somewhere like this to open up so close to home! Ray, the owner, was so welcoming and awesome! The customer service we received gets 5 stars alone. On top of that, everything we had was amazing as well. My favorite thing we had was a toss between the Pinchelote and Flower Basket!!! Need to go back asap for these bomb dishes!!!!

excerpts: We also tried the papas rojas... the sauce on top was absolutely delectable.
Made the right choice this time, and I skipped the beer for the refreshing horchata!
papas rojas.author: Roma R.
papas rojas.review:
Thrilled yet again!! Got to try the eggplant tacos which were filled with a crispy, fried eggplant, mole, spinach and onions- filling yet light enough to enjoy some churros too! We also tried the papas rojas... the sauce on top was absolutely delectable.
Made the right choice this time, and I skipped the beer for the refreshing horchata!

excerpts:
We also order ordered Papas Rojas, Guac and Chips, Pinchelotes and 
Cauliflower Civiche.
The papas rojas (potatoes) was so good that my group order another one.
I was not a fan of the cauliflower civiche.
I was hoping they had their roasted cauliflower
papas rojas.author: Sandy B.
papas rojas.review:
Tacos shouldn't only be consume on Tuesdays, right? Good any day of the week in my opinion. Chisme is located in the Union Square area right across from my favorite restaurant, Liholiho. Very cute interior with honey bears artwork along the walls. Open space with a good amount of seating. 

Concept: Order and take a number. Self serve water and utensils.

I came with a group of 4. We order Shrimp, Skirt Steak and Pulled Chicken Tacos. All tacos are 2 per order. My favorite was the shrimp tacos, so much flavors and texture in that bite. It was delicious! 

We also order ordered Papas Rojas, Guac and Chips, Pinchelotes and 
Cauliflower Civiche. The papas rojas (potatoes) was so good that my group order another one. I was not a fan of the cauliflower civiche. I was hoping they had their roasted cauliflower but bummer, no longer on their menu. 

We got the owner himself to serve us, which was amazing. He gave us great service, super friendly. My overall experience was good. The food was tasty and the presentation is Instagram worthy. Not my favorite taco spot in the city but will be making my way back very soon.

excerpts:
2x Papas Rojas
1x Guac and Chips
We initially only ordered 1 papas rojas, but decided it was yummy enough to get another order!
papas rojas.author: Kaje Y.
papas rojas.review:
As my yelp buddies and I were in search of our next date night, Chisme was recommended. I skipped the yelp newsletter that featured Chisme, but alas, our dinner location was set.

We entered into a fairly large area. We observed that it's an order-first-then-sit-down type of place. Along the wall are a few cute... bears? (They're also at he Union Square Ice Rink). 

While waiting for the group, I started with a Panda Petals Saison. It was pretty tasty! 

When the group got here, this was what we decided on:

2x Shrimp Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)
2x Skirt Steak Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)
2x Pulled Chicken Tacos (2 per order so 4 tacos total)

2x Papas Rojas
1x Guac and Chips
2x Pinchelotes (Corn on the cob - 2 per order)
1x Cauliflower Civiche

Our general consensus was Steak, Shrimp, Chicken in that order. I personally LOVED the flavours in the shrimp taco. 

We initially only ordered 1 papas rojas, but decided it was yummy enough to get another order! The cauliflower civiche, while a bit odd in theory, worked pretty well, however it was missing a little something that I can't put my finger on.

The guac was spot on, and the pinchelotes were quite good. Personally, I'd love more it if it had a hint of garlic on it!

I spent some time talking to the owner on the thought process of establishing this place. He had an idea for each dish and how it should taste. There was one dish we wanted to try, but he took it off the menu due to it coming out a little inconsistent. That tells you a lot of what this place is trying to offer. There's also a lack of arrogance and he seems to be customer focused.

Overall, this place does well and is heading in the right direction. I was really happy with the dishes. I really look forward to an updated menu in a few months to see if any other unique dishes pop up to try. 

I'll be back, to try all the beers, and definitely for more steak and shrimp tacos!

excerpts: We also had the Papas Rojas with Mole Sauce, and draft beer to round the meal out.
The mole sauce on the papas rojas was so good!
Crispy potatoes topped with a savory white sauce.
Yum!
Also, don't forget about their spicy green salsa.
papas rojas.author: Lanie L.
papas rojas.review:
When I found out that a new taco shop opened up in the 'hood, my interest perked.

When I found out that they had vegan options, (not just a one or two but at least half the menu is vegan-friendly!) I knew I had to try it out asap. (That fiery 'Hot & New' business flame only lasts so long!)

Located off Sutter & Leavenworth, it mirrors power-player Liholiho and the faux-bougie corporate l*ser Papa John's. If I lived in the direct area, I'd be happy to see this new affordable, fresh, and delicious restaurant opening up.

Reading the reviews, it seems like a lot of Yelpers are complaining about the "expensive prices" of these tacos. Come on people, have you not been to Tacolicious or Nick's Crispy Tacos? This is not your average hole-in-the-wall taqueria. As much as I love my $2 tacos filled with beans and rice, this place offers a more modern take on Mexican cuisine with eclectic ingredients. Could you find fried plantain tacos at a standard taqueria? Don't think so. The diverse ingredients equate to a slightly higher price, but I don't believe it is priced exorbitantly. 

For dinner, we had the Via Via (Fried Plaintain) tacos and the Jackfruit tacos. We also had the Papas Rojas with Mole Sauce, and draft beer to round the meal out.

Both tacos were delicious! The Fried plaintains were paired with refried black beans which were a delicious blend of sweet & savory. They fried the jackfruit, which gave it a crunchy texture. This paired very nicely with their fresh greens and mint verde. The mole sauce on the papas rojas was so good! Crispy potatoes topped with a savory white sauce. Yum! 
Also, don't forget about their spicy green salsa. It definitely has a kick to it!

They offer bottled beer and wine, but we opted for the draft. I forgot what the brand of beer it was, but we went for the Cascade Sunshine, which is a light IPA. It paired very nicely with our meal.

If I had to nitpick something, I wish we could mix & match tacos. Since all the vegan tacos are $8 for 2, maybe at least we could mix and match the vegan options? Or maybe mix and match, but reflect the price of the higher priced taco. [Ex: Someone buys a steak & shrimp taco, it would still be $11 for the two].

Overall, Chisme offers delicious tacos in a cozy environment at a decent price. I applaud the extensive vegan options and bold flavors not usually seen at a standard taqueria. I will be back again soon!

excerpts: I've had the jackfruit tacos, mahi mahi tacos and their papas Rojas.
The portions are great and make sure to ask for their homemade spicy sauce.
papas rojas.author: Jack C.
papas rojas.review: I love this place! I've had the jackfruit tacos, mahi mahi tacos and their papas Rojas. The portions are great and make sure to ask for their homemade spicy sauce.

excerpts: We also tried the papas rojas (which were just ok) and the churros (yum!).
papas rojas.author: Jenn F.
papas rojas.review:
This place has great vegan and vegetarian options. We ordered the jackfruit, eggplant, and plantain tacos. The jackfruit and eggplant are breaded and fried. We also tried the papas rojas (which were just ok) and the churros (yum!). 

The ambiance is nice, but they had the same eight Selena songs on rotation while we were there. A suggestion to mix it up: get some Luis Miguel and Marc Anthony in there!

excerpts: Their papas rojas were good
but I could only eat a few before getting overwhelmed by them.
papas rojas.author: Daisy O.
papas rojas.review: Tbh their churros alone are 5 stars! If you come here, you should definitely try them. Everything else we tried was good but not great. The tacos had way too many slimy onions, and the sauce was not mole sauce. It was just a dark red sauce. Their papas rojas were good but I could only eat a few before getting overwhelmed by them. We did really like their poblano potato bowl and some green salsa they gave us on the side. Overall I would only come back to have their churros for dessert, sooo good!

excerpts: Now for the food: guac was good, equivalent if not identical to Chipotle, papas rojas were too salty, though the concept is good (fried potatoes + ranch), and the tacos (I tried chicken and skirt steak) were just plain ole' bad.
Too saucy/messy, the meat was gritty, and toppings got lost and overwhelmed by the saucyness of the tacos.
I will say they have A LOT of vegetarian options here, especially taco options I didn't try, so if your a vegetarian maybe ignore my review and try this place out.
I know from my veggie friends that taco places are always a challenge so kudos to Chisme for that.
For the rest of you meat eaters, this is SF there's way better
(and cheaper!)
tacos just about anywhere else.
papas rojas.author: Gabriella M.
papas rojas.review:
Was so excited to try a new taco place! To start off positive, their hidden gem is the coconut horchata. Seriously it was so good! Next time I'm in the area I'll stop in just for that. Tip: If you're gonna try it, ask for less ice. 

Now for the food: guac was good, equivalent if not identical to Chipotle, papas rojas were too salty, though the concept is good (fried potatoes + ranch), and the tacos (I tried chicken and skirt steak) were just plain ole' bad. Too saucy/messy, the meat was gritty, and toppings got lost and overwhelmed by the saucyness of the tacos. I will say they have A LOT of vegetarian options here, especially taco options I didn't try, so if your a vegetarian maybe ignore my review and try this place out. I know from my veggie friends that taco places are always a challenge so kudos to Chisme for that. For the rest of you meat eaters, this is SF there's way better (and cheaper!) tacos just about anywhere else.

excerpts: Had the chicken tacos and shared some papas rojas.
Next time I'll try the plantain tacos.
papas rojas.author: Juan D.
papas rojas.review: The food and the service was amazing! Will come back for sure! Had the chicken tacos and shared some papas rojas. Next time I'll try the plantain tacos.

excerpts: Also, we ordered coconut horchata and they were boooombbb!
coconut horchata.author: Tanya D.
coconut horchata.review:
I've had this bookmarked on my "must-try vegan spots" for quite awhile now. Today, I finally decided to try it out! Honestly so surprised how vegan tacos can taste so good. 

First, I ordered 2 eggplant tacos. I added guacamole for an extra dollar. The taco was honestly full of flavor! I didn't really have much complaints other than I wished the guacamole was evenly distributed lol I felt like it was just a big blob. The amount of guacamole was also a little too much.. but who am I to complain? More is better than less. I couldn't finish my two tacos because I was so full from eating their chips & salsa- which was also very delicious! I loved their red and green salsa. Their green salsa was so creamy and spicy. Additionally, my boyfriend ordered a mahi-mahi taco and he liked it as well. Also, we ordered coconut horchata and they were boooombbb!

Secondly, the service was great! All staff were kind and helpful :)

Last, I loved loved the atmosphere. The lights were purposely on the dark side and it made me a little sleepy lmao. I was so full that I was about to pass out in the restaurant.

Overall, my total was $41 which is a little expensive but it was worth it for the experience! Definitely recommend!

excerpts: (the only thing I didn't love was the coconut horchata, I thought it was too sweet for me)
coconut horchata.author: Su Lin Y.
coconut horchata.review:
Hands down the best tacos I had outside of Mexico. 

I love this place!!! You know when you eat something and you feel all nourished and happy and wholesome? That's how I felt after having the food at Chisme. Ingredients were really fresh, and the even the fried food wasn't too greasy. Everything was just absolutely delicious, and perfect and I felt satiated and satisfied and very happy. 

I'm not vegan, but my friend and I thought the vegan options sounded delicious, so we got the eggplant and jackfruit tacos. Best decision ever. It's so delicious, it just doesn't cross your mind that you're eating something vegan. The combinations of toppings also went so well, and might I say the hot sauce also had just the right amount of heat. My friend LOVED the peanut mole in the eggplant tacos. (Tip: it's on the steak tacos as well!)

We had an early dinner around 5.30pm, and knowing myself, I knew I'd be hungry by around 8pm, so I got a box of steak tacos and cauliflower ceviche to go (recommended by the lovely lady at the counter). I personally preferred the vegan tacos to the steak tacos, but they were also so good. Cauliflower ceviche came with fresh, warm, chips. The whole combination was to die for. The ceviche was so incredibly refreshing, the perfect late evening snack I wanted! 

Also ate pinchelotes... and I love corn, so that was good too.

Everything everything EVERYTHING was good. You can't go wrong here :) (the only thing I didn't love was the coconut horchata, I thought it was too sweet for me)

excerpts: The coconut horchata was seriously one of the best I've ever had.
coconut horchata.author: Kimberly L.
coconut horchata.review:
Solid taco spot with some interesting menu options.

The coconut horchata was seriously one of the best I've ever had.  Must get!

I was having a hard time deciding what to order but ultimately went with my go to... Steak for the win.

It was a bit messy but damn delicious!

The elote was way too cheesy for me and the guac was ok but I'd go back to try some of the other fun taco options for sure!

excerpts: Coconut horchata - I never get horchata, but the coconut was screaming for us to try it.
MC doesn't like horchata either, but we both were highly obsessed.
coconut horchata.author: Dianna C.
coconut horchata.review:
Shrimp tacos - delicious, plenty of shrimp. I was worried they would skimp out. They did not! 

Jackfruit vegan taco - I've been super curious about jackfruit as a meat substitute. It definitely looks like meat, but it doesn't taste like meat. However this taco was pretty dang delicious. 

Coconut horchata - I never get horchata, but the coconut was screaming for us to try it. MC doesn't like horchata either, but we both were highly obsessed. Not sweet at all, which is how we both like it!!! 

Churro - I wish there was an option for no caramel sauce, since I know not everyone likes caramel, BUT it was really good. It was still warm when we had it sitting out while we finished eating the rest of our tacos. Comes with fresh vanilla whipped cream. 

Water - it's colored.... why?? The only unnecessary thing there. Haha. 

I want to go back to try the other tacos.

excerpts: The coconut horchata was my favorite item here.
I'd prob come back just for this.
coconut horchata.author: Denise L.
coconut horchata.review:
Here's my chisme on Chisme: I think that the tacos are really flavorful and were prepared with an interesting twist. I had the shrimp tacos and my date had the steak tacos. Honestly, it reminded me of a blue apron recipe I cooked with a few months ago. 

The coconut horchata was my favorite item here. I'd prob come back just for this. I love horchata in general. 

The churros were very unique as well since they were filled with caramel in the center. 

Not sure if I'd make this my go-to place in my new hood but I appreciate the concept of what seems like "healthier" Mexicali food.

excerpts:
Their jack fruit tacos are a must.. 
along with the coconut horchata..
coconut horchata.author: Natalie F.
coconut horchata.review:
Awesome!! 
Their jack fruit tacos are a must.. 
along with the coconut horchata.. 
they play good music, and are extremely friendly :)

I am not a vegan, nor vegetarian, and I very much enjoyed this place.

excerpts: Get the coconut horchata - best mocktail ever!!
coconut horchata.author: Jenna M.
coconut horchata.review:
Woahhhhh - welcome to the neighborhood! This is now officially my favorite restaurant in my area! This is going to be dangerous - amazing tacos at my doorstep, ah! 

Vegan and non-vegans alike... this place is for you!!

I tried the via via taco (fried plantains) and the jackfruit taco - both full of flavors and and oh so tasty! The Via Via  highlights the tastiness of the plantains, combined with the mango salsa and coconut ranch sauce, Wowy! The jackfruit is deep fried, so crispy and moist. Add some of their hot sauce to this taco for even more good flavor. Hot sauce is out of this world good. Also, very hot for spicy lovers!

Get the coconut horchata - best mocktail ever!! Get it.

Atmosphere wise they have done a phenomenal job. Big windows for natural light, large tables for big groups (up to 6). Up beat spanish music playing, really gives the place a great vibe. 

Service is fast and friendly.

it's better than most home made ones at restaurants or at home.
If you have room for dessert then get the churros....
they have caramel in the inside and comes with cream!
BEYOND AMAZING!!!!
coconut horchata.author: Erica C.

If you like a little kick to your guacamole, then add their house made spicy salsa to add that fire to your meal. If you love horchata like me, then I suggest getting the coconut horchata it's better than most home made ones at restaurants or at home. If you have room for dessert then get the churros....they have caramel in the inside and comes with cream! BEYOND AMAZING!!!!

excerpts: To start off positive, their hidden gem is the coconut horchata.
Seriously it was so good!
Next time I'm in the area
I'll stop in just for that.

coconut horchata.review:
Was so excited to try a new taco place! To start off positive, their hidden gem is the coconut horchata. Seriously it was so good! Next time I'm in the area I'll stop in just for that. Tip: If you're gonna try it, ask for less ice. 

Now for the food: guac was good, equivalent if not identical to Chipotle, papas rojas were too salty, though the concept is good (fried potatoes + ranch), and the tacos (I tried chicken and skirt steak) were just plain ole' bad. Too saucy/messy, the meat was gritty, and toppings got lost and overwhelmed by the saucyness of the tacos. I will say they have A LOT of vegetarian options here, especially taco options I didn't try, so if your a vegetarian maybe ignore my review and try this place out. I know from my veggie friends that taco places are always a challenge so kudos to Chisme for that. excerpts: Try the coconut horchata or regret it!
coconut horchata.author: Chris K.
coconut horchata.review:
I have already ate here twice! Finally Nob Hill has a restaurant that doesn't just serve taco truck style tacos. I ordered the steak tacos the first trip and the plantain the next time both times with guacamole, all colorful and delicious! Guacamole tasted very fresh and the food was all scratch made as expected. Try the coconut horchata or regret it! 

Service was quick and the staff was very professional. My friends and I enjoyed the fun ambiance and we did not feel rushed even though there was a line out the door. The couple next to us had the elotes and said it was fantastic, definitely getting it next time. Open late is a huge plus!

excerpts: coconut horchata.. fantastic!
Great service and ambiance... just what the neighborhood needed!
coconut horchata.author: Maggie G.
coconut horchata.review: Amazing food! Guacamole was delish! We had the chicken taco and the vegan/vegetarian taco which honestly was my fave and I'm not even a vegetarian.: coconut horchata.. fantastic! Great service and ambiance... just what the neighborhood needed!

excerpts: Jackfruit tacos, homemade coconut horchata, delicious sides and plantain chimichangas for dessert?!
Couldn't have wished for a better place to open up close to home!
Also Michelle who runs the restaurant is super sweet!
coconut horchata.author: Fsa A.
coconut horchata.review: Jackfruit tacos, homemade coconut horchata, delicious sides and plantain chimichangas for dessert?! Couldn't have wished for a better place to open up close to home! Also Michelle who runs the restaurant is super sweet!

excerpts: We had a hard time deciding between the Sweet Chimichanga ($7) and the Caramel Churros ($7).
However, we had no regrets when our caramel stuffed churros arrived with the sweetest, homemade whipped cream.
Every.
Damn.
Bite was incredible.
caramel churros.author: Hannah S.
caramel churros.review:
Taco Tuesday anyone?? This place is as good as it gets! Walking in, I felt instantly calmed by the beautiful details of the place; the Fnnch mural, the simplistic light fixtures, the 'magic' pink water... Everything in there made me want to stay.

Greeted by a huge smile, we gathered some information about the menu before deciding on the skirt steak tacos ($11), the shrimp tacos ($10), and the cauliflower ceviche ($7). The food was out in a prompt fashion, and our taste buds lit up when we took our first bite. Holy moly peanut butter MOLE. These flavors WORK. Every bite was just like the first - magical. Adding the lime wedge to the cauliflower ceviche gave it an acidity that perfect the dish, and the staff brought more chips as soon as we finished the first batch.

We were so blown away that we decided to go in for dessert as well. We had a hard time deciding between the Sweet Chimichanga ($7) and the Caramel Churros ($7). However, we had no regrets when our caramel stuffed churros arrived with the sweetest, homemade whipped cream. Every.Damn.Bite was incredible. I have never enjoyed a churro so wholeheartedly.

So yes, come here. This is a humble restaurant serving some of the best damn food around at a totally affordable place. I am #blessed to live just around the corner and will be a frequent visitor here!

excerpts: The Caramel Churros!!!
Omg they are worth getting!
Homemade cream and the churros have a caramel Creme on the inside!
Uuuugh i want more!!
And let me tell you that i don't like sweets
but these churros were just soooooo good!
caramel churros.author: Ada N.
caramel churros.review:
Wow i was very impressed by this restaurant! I came here on a week day for dinner and there was no line but a bunch of people here hanging out and eating! The atmosphere was pretty hipster, a little different from a taqueria but very pleasant. The workers were all very nice and helpful, suggesting very good things they definitely know their menu!

The first thing i got was a white wine sangria, very good and refreshing! The freshly cut apples in it were so crisp and worth trying! 

Next i ordered the steak tacos and man were they good, there was so much flavor! Nicely cooked, not chewy or anything. One this i hate about steak tacos is that if i take a bite, the whole piece of steak of steak will come out but that did not happen which made the meal enjoyable. I also had a shrimp taco that my bf had and it's not one of this tacos that barely have any shrimp, i had shrimp in every bite and it was in this sauce that had some spice so it has a slight kick but not spicy. It was topped with a salsa that had mangos and they weren't this giant diced tomatoes and mangos, its was a small dice which made eating pretty easy. Both the tacos were soooo good! But the spicy sauce that they usually ask if you want, it is SOOOO SPICY! Just a warning.

Drum roll to my favorite part of my meal! The Caramel Churros!!! Omg they are worth getting! Homemade cream and the churros have a caramel Creme on the inside! Uuuugh i want more!! And let me tell you that i don't like sweets but these churros were just soooooo good! Everyone needs to try them!

Overall, would come back here again! :)

caramel churros.author: Crystal F.
caramel churros.review:
Love this spot. It's fresh with quality ingredients. 
For those that like heat, their house hot sauce is killer but flavorful.

1. Vegetarian and vegan friendly

Personally not huge on the jackfruit but the eggplant tacos were amazing. Breaded eggplant with peanut mole. Recommending adding the guacamole on top.

The mashed potato bowl is delicious and comforting

The quesadilla is one of my favorites in the city. The tortilla is super light and flaky, just perfect!

2. Beverages

There's a selection of wine and beer. For those who like strong ginger drinks, they have a great ginger tonic that packs a punch. 

3. Dessert

Had the caramel churros with chocolate sauce and home made whipped cream. Definitely worth saving room to have this.

caramel churros.review: Amazing first experience. Tried most of the tacos and each one did not disappoint. Varies flavors from each taco and very distinct too. The chips they had are freshly made by hand as well and very crisp. Their house sauce is lemony with a kick of spicy and goes very well with the chips.
